t: Psalm 135
Praise*pn the Lord.*s Praise*pn the name of the Lord;*s praise*ld him, you servants of the Lord,*s
you*ln who minister in the house of the Lord,*s in*ld the courts of the house of our God.
Praise*pn the Lord,*s for the Lord*s is good; sing*ld praise to his name, for that is pleasant.
For*ln the Lord*s has chosen Jacob to be his own, Israel*ld to be his treasured possession.
I*pn know that the Lord*s is great, that*ld our Lord is greater than all gods.
The*ln Lord*s does whatever pleases him, in*ld the heavens and on the earth, in*ld the seas and all their depths.
He*ln makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth; he*ld sends lightning with the rain and*ld brings out the wind from his storehouses.
He*pn struck down the firstborn of Egypt, the*ld firstborn of people and animals.
He*ln sent his signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt, against*ld Pharaoh and all his servants.
He*ln struck down many nations and*ld killed mighty kings—
Sihon*ln king of the Amorites, Og*ld king of Bashan, and*ld all the kings of Canaan—
and*ln he gave their land as an inheritance, an*ld inheritance to his people Israel.
Your*pn name, Lord,*s endures forever, your*ld renown, Lord,*s through all generations.
For*ln the Lord*s will vindicate his people and*ld have compassion on his servants.
The*pn idols of the nations are silver and gold, made*ld by human hands.
They*ln have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes,*ld but cannot see.
They*ln have ears, but cannot hear, nor*ld is there breath in their mouths.
Those*ln who make them will be like them, and*ld so will all who trust in them.
All*pn you Israelites, praise the Lord;*s house*ld of Aaron, praise the Lord;*s
house*ln of Levi, praise the Lord;*s you*ld who fear him, praise the Lord.*s
Praise*ln be to the Lord*s from Zion, to*ld him who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise*pn the Lord.*s
